New Records: Lionel Messi scored his 14th goal in 38 Copa América games and 109th in 186 caps for the national side.
Key Match Events: Argentina took the lead through Julián Álvarez on 22 minutes
Lionel Messi got the slightest of touches to divert Enzo Fernández’s effort past Maxime Crépeau in the 51st minute
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina were the heavy tournament favourites
Canada had recovered to progress past Chile and Peru in the group before earning a last-four berth via a shootout win over Venezuela
Post-Match Reflections: Canada’s defeat ended their impressive progress at the tournament
Argentina will take on Uruguay or Colombia in the final at the Miami Dolphins’ Hard Rock Stadium
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a hot and humid MetLife Stadium
Argentina’s captain, Lionel Messi, completed the full 90 minutes, allaying fears about the adductor injury that saw him rested for the group stage game in Miami against Peru
